marketNews.title: ü§ù RI Signs Trade Agreements with the European Union & Canada
marketNews.content: Indonesia on Tuesday (9/23) signed a comprehensive economic partnership agreement with the European Union (IEU-CEPA), which will eliminate tariffs for 80% of Indonesian products exported to the European Union, including palm oil, coffee, and textile products. In return, Indonesia will eliminate import duties on 98.5% of goods imported from the European Union and simplify entry procedures for products including cars and food products. The Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, targets the IEU-CEPA to take effect on January 1, 2027, where the government hopes exports to the European Union can double in the first 5 years of implementation. Nevertheless, Indonesia's nickel export ban - which is currently still in dispute at the WTO - remains in effect. Meanwhile, the EU's anti-deforestation regulation, which Indonesia opposes, was also not cancelled, although its implementation was postponed for 1 year until December 30, 2026. Even though the IEU-CEPA is targeted to take effect only on January 1, 2027, the General Chairman of the Indonesian Palm Oil Producers Association, Eddy Martono, said that his party expects Indonesian palm oil exports to the European Union to increase to 4 million tons in 2026 from an estimate of 3.3 million tons in 2025. This forecast is supported by the postponement of the EU's anti-deforestation regulation. In addition to the European Union, Indonesia on Wednesday (9/24) signed a trade agreement with Canada, which will provide better access for 90% of Indonesian export products to that country, including textiles, paper, processed food, and palm oil. Canada's Minister of International Trade, Maninder Sidhu, stated that this agreement is expected to open duty-free access for up to 95% of Canadian goods exported to Indonesia within the next 8-12 months, and is capable of doubling the trade value between the two countries in 6 years. In 2024, the total trade value between Indonesia-Canada reached 3.6 billion US dollars, while the trade between Indonesia-European Union was 30.1 billion US dollars, according to Reuters reports. The agreement with Indonesia is part of the efforts by Canada and the European Union to expand their reach into Asia. Reuters reports that Canada will sign a trade agreement with the Philippines shortly, and is considering similar steps with Malaysia, Japan, and South Korea. Meanwhile, Bloomberg mentions that the European Union is seeking trade agreements with Malaysia, the Philippines, and Thailand. As we previously wrote, sectorally, we see that the significance of this trade agreement for Indonesia lies in the textile sector, which absorbs a lot of labor. Meanwhile, the potential for increased demand from the trade agreement and the postponement of the EU's anti-deforestation regulation potentially gives a positive sentiment to the CPO sector.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: As we previously wrote, sectorally, we see that the significance of this trade agreement for Indonesia lies in the textile sector, which absorbs a lot of labor. Meanwhile, the potential for increased demand from the trade agreement and the postponement of the EU's anti-deforestation regulation potentially gives a positive sentiment to the CPO sector.

tickerNews.title: $CDIA Denies Rumor of Acquiring ExxonMobil Indonesia
tickerNews.content: CDIA: Chandra Daya Investasi Director, Merly, denied rumors stating that CDIA plans to acquire ExxonMobil Indonesia. Merly's statement emerged after Bloomberg Technoz reported on Thursday (9/25) that CDIA plans to take over ExxonMobil Indonesia.

tickerNews.title: United Tractors (UNTR) August 2025 Equipment Sales and Mining Contractor Performance
tickerNews.content: UNTR: United Tractors recorded sales of Komatsu brand heavy equipment totaling 310 units in August 2025 (-16% MoM, -29% YoY). This result brought Komatsu sales during 8M25 to reach 3,408 units (+16% YoY), equivalent to 74% of the 2025 target of 4,600 units, with market share dropping to 23% (vs. 1H25: 26%, 8M24: 28%). From the mining contractor segment, UNTR recorded coal production volume of 95.9 million tons (-1.8% YoY) during 8M25, with overburden removal at 732.8 million bcm (-9.5% YoY).

tickerNews.title: Darma Henwa (DEWA) to Audit 9M25 Financial Statements for 2025 Audited Report Preparation
tickerNews.content: DEWA: Darma Henwa announced that the 9M25 financial statements will be audited for the preparation of the audited financial statements for the 2025 fiscal year and other purposes, although the company did not elaborate further. DEWA explained that the 9M25 financial statements will be submitted no later than December 31, 2025.

tickerNews.title: Bank CIMB Niaga (BNGA) Reports August 2025 Net Profit and 8M25 Performance
tickerNews.content: BNGA: Bank CIMB Niaga recorded bank-only net profit of 434 billion rupiah in August 2025 (-9% YoY, -2% MoM). This result led the bank-only net profit for 8M25 to decline to 4.2 trillion rupiah (-3% YoY), equivalent to 60% of the 2025 F consensus estimate (vs. 8M24: 64% realization of consolidated net profit for 2024). The decline in net profit in August 2025 was caused by provisioning expenses rising +172% YoY, even though PPOP still grew +10% YoY. Meanwhile, performance during 8M25 was suppressed by a decline in PPOP (-5% YoY) due to increased opex (+2% YoY) and weakening Net Interest Income (-2% YoY), which was reflected in the decline of the bank-only Net Interest Margin (NIM) to 3.6% (vs. 8M24: 3.9%, 1H25: 3.5%). Provisioning expenses throughout 8M25 still decreased by -7% YoY, so the decline in net profit was not as deep as the decline in PPOP.

tickerNews.title: PT Bakrie Metal Industries Increases Stake in VKTR Teknologi Mobilitas
tickerNews.content: VKTR: VKTR Teknologi Mobilitas shareholder, PT Bakrie Metal Industries, purchased approximately 43.5 million VKTR shares at an undisclosed price on September 22, 2025. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Bakrie Metal Industries in VKTR increased from 14.98% to 15.08%.

tickerNews.title: Johan Rose Sells Shares in Era Mandiri Cemerlang (IKAN)
tickerNews.content: IKAN: The controller and President Director of Era Mandiri Cemerlang, Johan Rose, sold 20 million IKAN shares at a price of 140 rupiah per share during the period of September 1-2, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 2.8 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Johan Rose's ownership in IKAN decreased from 20.4% to 18%.

tickerNews.title: Dorab Mistry Forecasts CPO Prices to Rise Significantly in Late 2025 and Early 2026
tickerNews.content: Director of Godrej International Ltd., Dorab Mistry, forecasts that CPO prices could rise by about +15% and breach the 5,000 ringgit per ton level by the end of 2025. Mistry also predicts CPO prices could rise to 5,500 ringgit per ton in 1Q26, potentially the highest level since June 2022. Mistry bases his projections on the end of the CPO production cycle, the ongoing government takeover of illegal palm oil plantations in Indonesia, the planned implementation of the B50 program by Indonesia next year, and high prices of substitute products such as oilseeds. Additionally, Mistry assesses that the Indonesian government's efforts in taking over illegal palm oil plantations could reduce CPO productivity, which is currently in a stagnation or even negative phase. Mistry also forecasts that CPO supply will only increase by 1 million tons in 2025-2026, lower than the previous year's level of 1.5 million tons.

tickerNews.title: Freeport-McMoRan Declares Force Majeure at Grasberg Mine, Expects Lower 3Q25 Sales
tickerNews.content: Freeport-McMoRan (NYSE: FCX) on Wednesday (9/24) announced a force majeure at the Grasberg mine, Central Papua. The company also forecasts consolidated sales for copper and gold in 3Q25 to be lower by -4% and -6% respectively compared to previous estimates. Bloomberg noted that prior to this event, the Grasberg mine contributed approximately 3.2% of global mined copper supply this year. The Grasberg mine also accounts for almost 30% of Freeport-McMoRan's copper production and 70% of its gold production. Freeport-McMoRan stated that the gradual recovery and ramp-up of operations at Grasberg is likely to occur in 1H26. The company also indicated that PT Freeport Indonesia's production in 2026 could be lower by about -35% compared to previous forecasts.

tickerNews.title: Upstream Oil and Gas Investment Realization Reaches 55% of 2025 Target by 8M25
tickerNews.content: SKK Migas noted that the realization of upstream oil and gas investment during 8M25 reached approximately 9.4 billion US dollars or approximately 153 trillion rupiah, equivalent to 55% of the 2025 target of 16.5 billion US dollars. Specifically, new exploration investment realized amounted to 500 million US dollars or approximately 8.4 trillion rupiah during 8M25, equivalent to 33% of the 2025 target of 1.5 billion US dollars. Meanwhile, the realization of new exploration well drilling reached 18 wells during 8M25, equivalent to 36.9% of the 2025 target of 46 wells. The Head of SKK Migas, Djoko Siswanto, estimates that 43 exploration wells can be realized (93.5% of the 2025 target).

tickerNews.title: INA Signs MoU for 825 Million Canadian Dollar Financing from Export Development Canada
tickerNews.content: Indonesia Investment Authority (INA) signed a memorandum of understanding for financing amounting to 825 million Canadian dollars or approximately 10 trillion rupiah from Export Development Canada, where this financing will be focused on funding private sector projects including infrastructure, clean technology, renewable energy, agriculture, and food.

tickerNews.title: IDX Postpones Short Selling Implementation Again Until Next Year
tickerNews.content: IDX Director, Jeffrey Hendrik, stated on Wednesday (9/24) that the implementation of short selling transactions will be postponed again for the next 6 months, considering the increasing volatility of global and domestic markets. Jeffrey mentioned that this decision follows directions from the OJK. Besides market volatility, Jeffrey said that this postponement allows more exchange members to participate in short selling transactions, given that so far only 2 exchange members have received short selling financing licenses. Previously, Jeffrey mentioned that short selling transactions could start on September 29, 2025, after being postponed since March 2025.

tickerNews.title: Bintang Samudera Mandiri Lines ($BSML) Announces Rp 28 Billion Non-Affiliate Ship Sale
tickerNews.content: Bintang Samudera Mandiri Lines ($BSML) announced the sale of 1 set of tugboats and barges worth 28 billion rupiah to a non-affiliated party, where this transaction is intended for ship rejuvenation and operational efficiency.

tickerNews.title: Momentum Breakout in Bid-Offer: The Momentum Trader's Main Weapon
tickerNews.content: "Healthy momentum breakout is seen when buyers are faster than sellers, volume explodes, and the order book starts thinning on the offer side." - ariefhidayatst
